result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Rivers Huffman

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Violation (DISCHARGE - BENCH WARRANT STATUS) Report

Defendant Christopher Rivers Huffman not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Christopher Rivers Huffman.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court takes no action as to bail.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WS

Defendant Christopher Rivers Huffman in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  State will resubmit no contact order.  Court reminded defendand of previously ordered no contact order.  Defense counsel requests additional pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Christopher Rivers Huffman in court.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Oral No Contact Order with W.S. and address listed in criminal complaint.

Defendant Christopher Rivers Huffman in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Christopher Rivers Huffman in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Rivers Huffman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher Rivers Huffman
Current: 1216 N 13th St, Milwaukee, WI 53205   (Effective: 07-08-2022)
Prior: 2131 North Holton Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
